title: League of Legends player perceptions study
body: Hey guys! This is the first survey in a multi-part study to better understand the frustrations that players face when playing League of Legends, and what factors of poor communication or misconceptions might contribute to that. Each survey is super short, I'd appreciate if you could help out! I'll be trying to post each survey 2 days apart, and I will be posting the results with my analysis once the study is complete.

replies.body:
Ok a couple things I noticed:

There should be a difference between RP pricing and IP pricing issues.

You have frontend client issues, but not ingame client issues. These seems a lot more prevalent to me. 

There is nothing about afk/disconnects.
This poll doesn't account for unranked players to participate -,-

AH! CRAPPOLI! WILL FIX NOW

Edit: FIXED. I'm sorry!!!
Do you have an estimate on when they'll be posted and where?

So I plan on doing 4 surveys (5 possibly? depending on the results) 2 days apart. I wanted to do a long-form analysis and post it at the end of the study, but I've also been considering posting the results of each survey after they close. 
The results will be posted here and on Reddit

I really would like to see how many people actually ticked this particular option:
> Discriminatory champion creation (e.g. mostly white champions)

Bizarre.

Other than that, seems a good and decent poll, it has most of LoL's issues listed clearly.
I actually quickly polled a core group of friends for options to include in the survey. Believe it or not, that got a couple hits. Interesting, ya?
